channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Please clear up the leaves, 17th November
item.description:
I never see a street cleaner around and haven't done in over 2 years. Send someone to clear the leaves it is not up to the people living here!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsworth Close, Elmers End, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Water continues to leak from fire hydrant….., 17th November
item.description:
As previously reported on FMS so I am having to report it AGAIN given my original report has been removed from FMS…..please do NOT remove reports from OUR FMS Bromley Council until they have been fixed…. Photos attached as at 8am Sunday 16 November…..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Road, Chislehurst, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Car accidents - no road signage, 17th November
item.description:
The junction of Redpost hill with Denmark Hill and Herne Hill roads is dangerous. Cars coming from Redpost Hill and turning right to go towards King's college and cars coming from Herne Hill and turning left to go towards Brockwell park often don't know whether to turn in front of each other or behind and create dangerous situations and sometimes accidents. Could arrows be drawn on the road so cars know how to proceed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal George Mews, Dulwich Village, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Montrose Avenue - the actual road itself, not the pavements, 17th November
item.description:
The road itself is full of fallen leaves that need sweeping. When it rains they become wet, slippery and mulchy. Also means you cannot see the road markings.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing waste, 17th November
item.description:
Waste bins are not empties regularly on Peckham rye. They are always overflowing. Summer is ridiculous and the council should provide larger bins and recycling for the main summer months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strakers Road, Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Rubbish is always left in this alleyway., 17th November
item.description:
Waste is not cleaned regularly and is a constant issue. There is always furniture or other rubbish. The council should put it on their regular rounds or install a camera. I have seen people who live in Forester road. Move furniture from their property and dump in this passage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Continual rubbish left in this location, 17th November
item.description:
For a few years now, someone has been living rubbish in this location. Probably dumping it when parked. The council is now proposing another cycle store leaving space between the existing one and new one, saving space for the tree. Therefore leaving more space for a continuous rubbish dump. There is rubbish in this location for most of the year now. I

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carden Road, Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recurrent potholes and no drainage, 17th November
item.description:
The pictures attached are from 2022 till now and I couldn't attach anymore. These potholes keep coming back no matter how many times they get fixed, possibly because of the massive puddle that forms everytime it rains. Also the buses keep splashing all the water onto the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Post Hill, Dulwich Village, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
